info.title: cg Payments Gateway API
info.description:
This guide will provide you with all the information you need to get started.

To simplify integration and testing each account has two modes: test-mode and live-mode. Both modes can be active at the same time - each mode has a separate set of parameters. We ensure that data created with test-mode will never reach real customers and will never cost you any money.

  Consider using our ready [Postman Collection](https://gw.cgpaytech.com/v1/static/cg-api.postman-collection.zip). Save it, unzip and import in Postman.

  

# How to start

**Online Payments**

With CommerceGate, you can receive online payments made with various payment methods. We provide a set of services and tools to let you receive payments, send payouts, download reports, and more.

**How to start using CommerceGate?**

When you want to integrate your commerce with CommerceGate services, you need to consider the following steps.

1. *Create a CommerceGate account* \
Create your CommerceGate account free of charge. You can create your CommerceGate account [here](https://merchants.cgpaytech.com/signup)
1. *Select how you want to integrate with CommerceGate services* \
According to your business needs, select how to integrate your shop with the CommerceGate services and tools.
1. *Perform tests* \
Verify that your integration works as expected. How to make testing you can find [here](#tag/Testing)
1. *Deploy to production* \
After you perform all the system testing and you have verified that everything is working properly, you can change to the production server, where the actual transactions are processed.

tags.name: Testing
tags.description:
You can test debit/credit card payments and alternative payment methods using provided card numbers or alternative payments data only. Such payments will be reflected in the backoffice.

### Preconfigured input data for debit/credit card payments

Currency: EUR, USD, BRL, MXN, COP, CLP, PEN, ARS  \
CVV: any 3 digits \
Exp. date: any valid \
Other currency:  ErrCode: 102 ExtErrCode: 0 ErrMsg: wrong currency \
Use card not from list: ErrCode: 101 ExtErrCode: 0 ErrMsg: card is inactive \
On 3d secure page don't fill security code or click cancel ErrCode: 106 ExtErrCode: 0 ErrMsg: Verification failed. Cardholder failed or cancelled 3-D Secure authentication

#### Payments without 3DS

| card number | result description | result |
|----|-----------------|---|
| 4200000000000018 | Approved or completed successfully | success |
| 5500000000000012 | Approved or completed successfully | success |
| 4373981108084536 | Verification failed. Cardholder failed or cancelled 3-D Secure authentication. | fail |
| 5533546595166486 | Verification failed. Cardholder failed or cancelled 3-D Secure authentication. | fail |

#### Payments with 3DS

| card number | result description | result |
|----|-----------------|---|
| 4263970000005262 | Approved or completed successfully | success |
| 5413330300001006 | Approved or completed successfully | success |
| 4012888888881881 | Verification failed. Cardholder failed or cancelled 3-D Secure authentication. | fail |
| 5413330300004000 | Verification failed. Cardholder failed or cancelled 3-D Secure authentication. | fail |
| 4159523316424755 | This card is issued for recurringPayment with 3Ds testing. Approved or completed successfully. Please note that you need to initiate a payemnt order before make a recurringPayment with 3Ds. | success |

In case with 3Ds flow test 3D page will be reflected:

![3Ds testing process](https://gw.cgpaytech.com/v1/static/img/3ds-testing-page.png)

Empty field should be filled with any value (e.g. `123`). Push "Continue" to get success 3D payment flow (or failed if you use corresponding card number, see table above). This is an emulation of 3Ds authentication process.

### Preconfigured input data for alternative payments

#### Pix payment method

Currency: **BRL** \
To test success payment:
  * use documentNumber 06957410600, 39027187819 for server-to-server integration
  * use documentNumber 069.574.106-00, 390.271.878-19 for hosted payment form integration
  * to check success payment without documentNumber please use amount 7300 currency BRL

To test fail payment:
  * use any other documentNumber - `{ errCode:525, errMessage:"NOK Test" }`

#### Pix payout method

Currency: **BRL** \
upstreamDestination: **894** \
To test success payment please use one of values below for `CustomerInfo.pixOperationDictKey`:
  * CPF -  06957410600
  * CNPJ - 00038166000105
  * email- fulanodasilva@gmail.com
  * phone - +5561912345678
  * EVP - 123e4567-e12b-12d1-a456–426655440000

To test fail payment:
  * others will trigger - `{ errCode:525, errMessage:"NOK Test" }`

#### Boleto payment method

Currency : **USD, BRL** \
Other currency - ErrCode: 102 ExtErrCode: 0 ErrMsg: wrong currency

To test success payment:
  * use this documentNumber: 525.075.708-00

To test fail payment:
  * all other documentNumber - `{ errCode:525, errMessage:"NOK Test" }`

#### Crypto payment method

To test success payment:
* specify amount 100.00 (Currency any in ISO3 code)
* order will be succeed in 60 seconds automatically

To test fail payment:
* specify any amount different than 100.00
* order will be failed in 60 seconds automatically

#### BIZUM payment method

Currency : EUR \
Other currency - ErrCode: 102 ExtErrCode: 0 ErrMsg: wrong currency

To test success payment:
  * use this phone:   `+34700000000`

To test fail payment:
  * all other data - `{ errCode:525, errMessage:"NOK Test" }`

#### Bank-transfer payment method (LATAM)

To test success payment please use request data listed below.

| Parameters | Mexico | Ecuador | Chile | Colombia | Peru | Argentina |
| :--- | :---: | :---: | :---: | :---: | :---: | :---: |
| TransactionInfo.currency | MXN | USD | CLP | COP | PEN | ARS |
| CustomerBankInfo.bankName | not applied | not applied | BANCO DEL ESTADO DE CHILE | BANCO DE BOGOTA | not applied | not applied |
| CustomerBankInfo.bankCode | not applied | not applied | CL0012 | CO1001 | not applied | not applied |
| CustomerBankInfo.fullName | Jose Ramirez | Jose Ramirez | Jose Ramirez | Jose Ramirez | Jose Ramirez | not applied |

| CustomerBankInfo.bankTransferCountryIso2 | MX | EC | CL | CO | PE  | AR |
| ConfigurationOptions.paymentMethod | bank-transfer | bank-transfer | bank-transfer | bank-transfer | bank-transfer | bank-transfer |

tags.name: Processing Flows
tags.description:
## Order Types The Gateway knows the following order types. *Note*: Depending on the PSP/Acquirer some transaction types may not be available/supported. | Type | Description | | :--- | --- | | **payment** | A "normal" payment. Debits the end customer with the given amount | | **recurringPayment** | A card-absent transaction initiated by the cardholder where the cardholder does not need to enter their card details as is using the payment credential previously stored with full card data payment. A subsequent recurring payment for a Payment | | **subscription** | Defines periodic collection payments without further input from the customer. Frequency and amount of these automatic charges is defined by subscription plan. Subscriptions are always billed to customer's current default card | | **subscriptionRecurringPayment** | A subsequent recurring payment for a Subscription | | **refund** | Reverses a payment which was previously performed with Debit or Capture | | **payout** | Credits the customer's account with the given amount | | **pushPayment** | This order type applied in case when pix static QR payment is used:
- *Pix Static QR Code* is like a single price tag. It doesn't change, and you as merchant can use it to charge multiple times the same amount for the same customer. It is therefore more flexible. There is no any expiration date for Pix Static QR Code it is valid until recipient pix account is still active. Recipient pix account will became not active if the pix key which is used has been removed from the pix directory [DICT](https://www.bcb.gov.br/estabilidadefinanceira/dict). You will be informed about this event by email in advance.
- *Pix Dynamic QR Code* is different from the previous one, the dynamic QR Code is unique for each transaction and works to pay specific bills, which will only be paid once. This means that it can only be used once - to make a second charge it is necessary to generate a new one. | Each order has an unique ID ("UUID") which you should store within your database, as you may need it for further operations like recurring or refund. ## Payments/Server-to-Server ### Debit/credit card payments processing flow **Please note** that card data is collected at the merchant's side in case of this method and merchant should be PCI DSS compliant. To initiate a payment you need to create a [request](#operation/createPayment) to get an orderId. All following communication with API is performing by using the oderId. After orderId is received from API response you can check the status of the order by the request. Also, the orderId status will be delivered to your callback URL as soon as the final status is received from the PSP/Acquirer. ![Processing flow scheme](https://gw.cgpaytech.com/v1/static/img/payment-with-card.svg "Debit/credit card payments processing flow") **Processing flow description:** 1. A customer initiates a check out process at the merchant’s website 1. The merchant initiates a payment order with `"paymentMethod": "credit-card"` 1. As a response merchant receives an orderId and order `"status": "pending"`. That means that the order request payload is validated and payment is processed. 1. After that merchant needs to get the payment status by orderId. The payment status can be received by callback or by additional polling of request to [order check endpoint](#operation/checkOrderById) by using corresponding orderId. Even if get OrderId details request is performed the callback will come anyway. 1. If orderId status is `"status": "threeDSecureRequested"` that means that payment will be processed with 3D authentication and additional challenge required from the merchant's side. The merchant should make a redirect of a user to the acsServerUrl received in the callback or in the api response to get OrderId details. 1. After that, the merchant continues to do polling of get OrderId details requests until the final status will be received. 1. Then final status is received or callback with terminal status is reported merchant provides access to the premium service for the customer. ### Boleto payments processing flow To initiate a payment you need to create a [request](#operation/createPayment) to get an orderId. All following communication with API is performing by using the oderId. After orderId is received from API response you can check the status of the order by the request. Also, the order status will be delivered to your callback URL as soon as the final status is received from the PSP/Acquirer. ![Boleto Processing flow scheme](https://gw.cgpaytech.com/v1/static/img/payment-boleto.svg "Boleto payments processing flow") **Processing flow description:** 1. A customer initiates a check out process at the merchant’s website 1. The merchant request a payment order with `"paymentMethod": "boleto"` 1. As a response merchant receives an orderId and order `"status": "pending"`. That means that the order request payload is validated and payment is processed. 1. After that merchant needs to get the payment status by orderId. The payment status can be received by callback or by additional polling of request to endpoint [order check endpoint](#operation/checkOrderById) by using corresponded orderId. Even if get OrderId details request is performed the callback will come anyway. 1. If orderId status is `"status": "threeDSecureRequested"` that means that additional challenge required from the merchant's side. The merchant should make a redirect of the customer to the acsServerUrl received to show the customer Boleto ticket payment info. Customer should pay a Boleto ticket at the ATM or bank. 1. After that, the merchant continues to do polling of get OrderId details requests until the final status will be received. 1. Then final status is received or callback with terminal status is reported merchant provides access to the premium service for the customer. ### Pix payments processing flow To initiate a payment you need to create a [request](#operation/createPayment) to get an orderId. All following communication with API is performing by using the oderId. After orderId is received from API response you can check the status of the order by the request. Also, the order status will be delivered to your callback URL as soon as the final status is received from the PSP/Acquirer. ![PIX Processing flow scheme](https://gw.cgpaytech.com/v1/static/img/payment-pix.svg "PIX payments processing flow") **Dynamic QR processing flow description:** 1. A customer initiates a check out process at the merchant’s website 1. The merchant creates a request for payment order with `"paymentMethod": "pix"` 1. As a response merchant receives an orderId and order `"status": "pending"`. That means that the order request payload is validated and payment is processed. 1. After that merchant needs to get the payment status by orderId. The payment status can be received by callback or by additional polling of request to endpoint [order check endpoint](#operation/checkOrderById) by using corresponded orderId. Even if get OrderId details request is performed the callback will come anyway. 1. If orderId status is `"status": "threeDSecureRequested"` that means that additional challenge required from the merchant's side. The merchant should make a redirect of the customer to the acsServerUrl received to show the customer the Pix QR code to continue payment. * the merchant can make a redirect of the customer to the acsUrl received to show the customer the Pix QR code to complete the payment. * the merchant can use received "barCodeString" value to generate QR code and promote it for the customer on their end. 1. After that, the merchant continues to do polling of get OrderId details requests until the final status will be received. 1. Then final status is received or callback with terminal status is reported merchant provides access to the premium service for the customer. **Static QR procesing flow description:** 1. A customer initiates a check out process at the merchant’s website 1. The merchant creates a request for payment order with `"paymentMethod": "pix"` 1. As a response merchant receives an orderId and order `"status": "pending"`. That means that the order request payload is validated and payment is processed. 1. After that merchant needs to get the payment status by orderId. The payment status can be received by callback or by additional polling of request to endpoint [order check endpoint](#operation/checkOrderById) by using corresponded orderId. Even if get OrderId details request is performed the callback will come anyway. 1. If orderId status is `"status": "threeDSecureRequested"` that means that additional challenge required from the merchant's side. The merchant should make a redirect of the customer to the acsServerUrl received to show the customer the Pix QR code to continue payment. * the merchant can make a redirect of the customer to the acsUrl received to show the customer the Pix QR code to complete the payment. * the merchant can use received "barCodeString" value to generate QR code and promote it for the customer on their end. 1. After that, the merchant continues to do polling of get OrderId details requests until the final status will be received. 1. Then final status is received or callback with terminal status is reported merchant provides access to the premium service for the customer. 1. In case with subsequent payment, callback with the new OrderID will be send ### Crypto processing flow To initiate a payment you need to create a [request](#operation/createPayment) to get an orderId. All following communication with API is performing by using the oderId. After orderId is received from API response you can check the status of the order by the request. Also, the order status will be delivered to your callback URL as soon as the final status is received from the PSP. ![Crypto Processing flow scheme](https://gw.cgpaytech.com/v1/static/img/payment-crypto.svg "CRYPTO payments processing flow") **Processing flow description:** 1. A customer initiates a check out process at the merchant’s website 1. The merchant creates a request for payment order with `"paymentMethod": "crypto"` 1. As a response merchant receives an orderId and order `"status": "pending"`. That means that the order request payload is validated and payment is processed. 1. After that merchant needs to get the payment status by orderId. The payment status can be received by callback or by additional polling of request to endpoint [order check endpoint](#operation/checkOrderById) by using corresponded orderId. Even if get OrderId details request is performed the callback will come anyway. 1. If orderId status is `"status": "threeDSecureRequested"` that means that additional challenge required from the merchant's side. The merchant should make a redirect of the customer to the acsServerUrl received to show the customer the payment details and recipient wallet to complete crypto payment. At the hosted url page customer has next options: * To make a copy of recipient wallet to make a transfer manually inside his crypto wallet * To scan QR code to be redirected to the crypto wallet to complete a payment * Click "Move to wallet button" to be redirected to the crypto wallet to complete a payment 1. After that, the merchant continues to do polling of get OrderId details requests until the final status will be received. 1. Then final status is received or callback with terminal status is reported merchant provides access to the premium service for the customer. ### Bank-transfer processing flow To initiate a payment you need to create a [request](#operation/createPayment) to get an orderId. All following communication with API is performing by using the oderId. After orderId is received from API response you can check the status of the order by the request. Also, the order status will be delivered to your callback URL as soon as the final status is received from the PSP. ![Bank-transfer Processing flow scheme](https://gw.cgpaytech.com/v1/static/img/payment-bank-transfer.svg "Bank-transfer payments processing flow") **Processing flow description:** 1. Сustomer selects payment with bank-transfer at the merchant’s website 1. The merchant request a payment order with `"paymentMethod": "bank-transfer"` 1. As a response merchant receives an orderId and order `"status": "pending"`. That means that the order request payload is validated and payment is processed now. 1. After that merchant needs to get the payment status by orderId. The payment status can be received by the callback or by additional polling of request to endpoint [order check endpoint](#operation/checkOrderById) by using corresponded orderId. Even if get OrderId details request is performed the callback will come anyway. 1. If orderId has `"status": "threeDSecureRequested"` that means that additional challenge is required from the merchant's side. The merchant should make a redirect of the customer to the acsServerUrl received to show the customer payment portal page. Customer performs a payment through their bank. 1. After that, the merchant continues to do polling of get OrderId details requests until the final status will be received. 1. Then final status is received or callback with terminal status is reported merchant provides access to the premium service for the customer. ### Voucher processing flow To initiate a payment you need to create a [request](#operation/createPayment) to get an orderId. All following communication with API is performing by using the oderId. After orderId is received from API response you can check the status of the order by the request. Also, the order status will be delivered to your callback URL as soon as the final status is received from the PSP. ![Voucher Processing flow scheme](https://gw.cgpaytech.com/v1/static/img/payment-voucher.svg "Voucher payments processing flow") **Processing flow description:** 1. Customer selects payment with voucher at the merchant’s website 1. The merchant request a payment order with `"paymentMethod": "voucher"` 1. As a response merchant receives an orderId and order `"status": "pending"`. That means that the order request payload is validated and payment is processed. 1. After that merchant needs to get the payment status by orderId. The payment status can be received by callback or by additional polling of request to endpoint [order check endpoint](#operation/checkOrderById) by using corresponded orderId. Even if get OrderId details request is performed the callback will come anyway. 1. If orderId has `"status": "threeDSecureRequested"` that means that additional challenge is required from the merchant's side. The merchant should make a redirect of the customer to the acsServerUrl received to show the customer the voucher.Customer performs a payment by providing cash and voucher at the authorised cash collection point. 1. After that, the merchant continues to do polling of get OrderId details requests until the final status will be received. 1. Then final status is received or callback with terminal status is reported merchant provides access to the premium service for the customer. ### Nequi QR processing flow To initiate a payment you need to create a [request](#operation/createPayment) to get an orderId. All following communication with API is performing by using the oderId. After orderId is received from API response you can check the status of the order by the request. Also, the order status will be delivered to your callback URL as soon as the final status is received from the PSP. ![Nequi QR Processing flow scheme](https://gw.cgpaytech.com/v1/static/img/payment-nequi-qr.svg "Nequi QR payments processing flow") **Processing flow description:** 1. Customer selects payment with nequi at the merchant’s website. 1. The merchant creates a request for payment order with `"paymentMethod": "nequi"`. 1. As a response merchant receives an orderId with `"status": "pending"`. That means that the order request payload is validated and payment is processed. 1. After that merchant needs to get the payment status by orderId. The payment status can be received with the callback or by additional polling of request to endpoint [order check endpoint](#operation/checkOrderById) by using corresponded orderId. Even if get OrderId details request is performed the callback will come anyway. 1. If orderId has `"status": "threeDSecureRequested"` that means that additional challenge is required from the merchant's side. The merchant should make a redirect of the customer to the acsServerUrl received to show the customer the QR code to continue payment. * the merchant can make a redirect of the customer to the acsServerUrl received to show the customer the QR code to complete the payment. * the merchant can use received "barCodeString" value to generate QR code and promote it for the customer on their end. 1. After that, the merchant continues to do polling of get OrderId details requests until the final status will be received. 1. Then final status is received or callback with terminal status is reported merchant provides access to the premium service for the customer. ### Nequi Push processing flow To initiate a payment you need to create a [request](#operation/createPayment) to get an orderId. All following communication with API is performing by using the oderId. After orderId is received from API response you can check the status of the order by the request. Also, the order status will be delivered to your callback URL as soon as the final status is received from the PSP. ![Nequi Push Processing flow scheme](https://gw.cgpaytech.com/v1/static/img/payment-nequi-push.svg "Nequi Push payments processing flow") **Processing flow description:** 1. Customer selects payment with nequi at the merchant’s website. 1. The merchant creates a request for payment order with `"paymentMethod": "nequi"`. 1. As a response merchant receives an orderId with `"status": "pending"`. That means that the order request payload is validated and payment is processed. 1. After that merchant needs to get the payment status by orderId. The payment status can be received with the callback or by additional polling of request to endpoint [order check endpoint](#operation/checkOrderById) by using corresponded orderId. Even if get OrderId details request is performed the callback will come anyway. 1. Customer receives push message in their nequi app and confirms payment. 1. Merchant receives callback or API resonse with terminal status. 1. Merchant provides access to the premium service for the customer. ### Webpay processing flow To initiate a payment you need to create a [request](#operation/createPayment) to get an orderId. All following communication with API is performing by using the oderId. After orderId is received from API response you can check the status of the order by the request. Also, the order status will be delivered to your callback URL as soon as the final status is received from the PSP. ![Webpay Processing flow scheme](https://gw.cgpaytech.com/v1/static/img/payment-webpay.svg "Webpay payments processing flow") **Processing flow description:** 1. Customer selects payment with webpay at the merchant’s website. 1. The merchant creates a request for payment order with `"paymentMethod": "webpay"`. 1. As a response merchant receives an orderId with `"status": "pending"`. That means that the order request payload is validated and payment is processed. 1. After that merchant needs to get the payment status by orderId. The payment status can be received with the callback or by additional polling of request to endpoint [order check endpoint](#operation/checkOrderById) by using corresponded orderId. Even if get OrderId details request is performed the callback will come anyway. 1. If orderId has `"status": "threeDSecureRequested"` that means that additional challenge is required from the merchant's side. The merchant should make a redirect of the customer to the `acsServerUrl` received to show the customer payment portal page. Customer performs a payment through card or "onepay" service. 1. After that, the merchant continues to do polling of get OrderId details requests until the final status will be received. 1. Then final status is received or callback with terminal status is reported merchant provides access to the premium service for the customer. ## Hosted Payment Form Payments/Subscriptions by using CommerceGate hosted payment form. **Please note** that card data or sensitive payment info for alternative payments are collected at the CG's payment form in case of this method. To initiate a payment you need to create a [request](#operation/createPaymentForm) to get a payment form Url. All following communication with API is performing by using the oderId which will come in the callback . After orderId is received from API you can check the status of the order by the request. Also, orderId status will be delivered to your callback URL as soon as the final status is received from the PSP/Acquirer. ![Payment Form processing flow scheme](https://gw.cgpaytech.com/v1/static/img/payment-form-hosted.svg "Payments by using CommerceGate hosted payment form") **Flow description:** 1. A user initiates a check out process at the merchant’s website 2. The merchant creates a request to get payment form by making a request with corresponding paymentMethod parameter defined. Allowed methods: credit-card, bizum, boleto, crypto, pix, p2p, bank-transfer, voucher, webpay, nequi, codi, upi, passthrough-wallet-card, wallet. 3. As a response merchant receives a payment form URL and PaymentFormId. 4. Merchant makes a redirect of a user to the payment form URL for the checkout process 5. At the next step the callback will come to successUrl/failUrl depending on the order status, where there are PaymentFormId and orderId created are presented. By using PaymentFormId and orderId merchant can match initial request data with the received orderId. Once the checkout is complete, our system will redirect the customer to the redirectUrl provided in the payment form request 6. After that merchant needs to get the payment status by orderId. The payment status can be received by the callback or by the additional polling of request to [order check endpoint](#operation/checkOrderById) by using corresponding orderId. Even if get OrderId details request is performed the callback will come anyway. 7. Then final status is received or callback with terminal status is reported merchant provides access to the premium service for the customer. ## Payouts To initiate a payout you need to create a [request](#operation/createPayout) to get an orderId. All following communication with API is performing by using the oderId. After orderId is received from API response you can check the status of the order by the request. Also, the order status will be notified to your callback URL as soon as the final status is received from the PSP/Acquirer. ![Processing flow scheme](https://gw.cgpaytech.com/v1/static/img/payouts.svg "Payouts ( Credits) processing flow") Processing flow description: 1. A customer initiates a payout operation at the merchant’s website 1. The merchant creates a request for payout with corresponded endpoint. Currently we provide ability to make a payout with: - a full card number - a credit card token - a reference to payment order - pix method - bank-transfer - voucher - Nequi 1. As a response merchant receives an orderId and order `"status": "pending"`. That means that the order request payload is validated and payout is processed. 1. After that merchant needs to get the payout status by orderId. The payout status can be received by callback or by additional polling of request to endpoint [order check endpoint](#operation/checkOrderById) by using corresponding orderId. Even if get OrderId details request is performed the callback will come anyway. 1. After that, the merchant continues to do polling of get OrderId details request until the final status will be received.

tags.name: Payments/Server-to-Server
tags.description:
This section describes how to create payment by server-to-server request providing all necessary data.

Also you can create payments with CommerceGate's [hosted payment form](#tag/Hosted-Payment-Form)

tags.name: Subscriptions
tags.description:
This section describes how to create subscription by server-to-server request providing all necessary data. \
Also you can create subscriptions with CommerceGate's [hosted payment form](#tag/Hosted-Payment-Form)

Subscription represents recurring payment that will result in charge to be automatically created for given customer.
Frequency and amount of these automatic charges is defined by a plan.
Subscriptions are always billed to customer's current default card.
Please note if subscription is cancelled it can`t be activated again. We can advice you to create new subscription one only.
Sandbox subscription limited with the 3 subscriptionRecurringPayment transactions, when limit is reached subscription will be cancelled in usual way.

tags.name: Chargebacks
tags.description:
Chargebacks are a special type of transactions as they cannot be triggered by the merchant. Chargebacks occur if a customer disputes to an item of his credit card bill at his issuing bank and the bank requests a chargeback. In this case, the amount is automatically refunded to the customers card account and deducted from your merchant account.

Customers who initiate chargebacks will automatically be blacklisted for future transactions and current active subscription will be cancelled. For details, please contact our risk team risk@cgpaytech.com.

You can also see a chargeback overview in the [merchant backoffice](https://merchants.cgpaytech.com) under the Chargebacks menu.

CommerceGate notifies you of any disputed payments. You can use these notifications to alert staff of (pending) chargebacks, so that they can take appropriate action.

A dispute callbacks notification contains:
  * "phase" : Indicates an event in the dispute process.
  * "chargeback.id" : The CommerceGate reference of the dispute process. All callback event phases related to a particular dispute have the same CommerceGate reference.
  * "orderId": The CommerceGate reference of the disputed payment.

Callbacks also contain a dispute status in the object:
  * "phaseStatus": This field gives more information about the stage the dispute is in.

The following table shows an overview of the callbacks phase and phase codes, what they mean, and where applicable, the possible values for the dispute phase:

| Callback "phase"  | "phaseStatus" values          | Description                                                                                                               | Merchant account finance impact |
|-------------------|-------------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|---------------------------------|
| Retrieval         | Incoming retrieval request    | Information requested for this payment.                                                                                   | no impact                       |
| Retrieval         | Submitted Retrieval request   | Сommercegate has sent information regarding the retrieval request to the bank. This callback informs you of that event.   | no impact                       |
| 1st chargeback    | Incoming first chargeback     | A payment was charged back.   | The amount is automatically refunded to the customers card account and deducted from your merchant account. Chargeback fees applied. Additional fees can be applied to your merchant account according to card network rules                      |
| Representment     | Successfully represented      | A chargeback has been defended towards the issuing bank. This stage is not final and a "second" chargeback can be presented by the issuing bank, resulting in losing the chargeback case.   | The amount is automatically returned to your merchant account.Representment fees applied.Additional fees can be applied to your merchant account according to card network rules |
| 2nd chargeback    | Incoming second chargeback    | The issuing bank declines the evidence submitted during defense of the original chargeback. | The amount is automatically refunded to the customers card account and deducted from your merchant account.Chargeback fees applied.Additional fees can be applied to your merchant account according to card network rules |
| Arbitration       | Successful arbitration        | Arbitration that you initiated has been accepted by the Card scheme. | The amount is automatically returned to your merchant account. Representment fees applied.Additional fees can be applied to your merchant account according to card network rules |
| Arbitration       | Lost arbitration              | Arbitration that you initiated has been declined by the Card scheme.  | Additional fees can be applied to your merchant account according to card network rules |

tags.name: Helpful information
tags.description:
## Error Codes

CommerceGate uses HTTP response status codes to indicate the success or failure of your API requests. If your order has failed status, CommerceGate returns attributes errMessage and errCode using appropriate values listed below in the table.

| errCode | errMessage | description |
|--|------|----------------|
| **-1** | Unrecognized error | The transaction was canceled for one of the reasons listed below. The technical team is working on displaying it correctly. For more detailed information, please get in touch with the support team. |
| **200** | Sanctioned country | The customer needs to check with the Merchant whether purchase can be made. |
| **210** | Restricted country | The customer needs to check with the Merchant whether purchase can be made. |
| **310** | Invalid amount | If the amount appears to be correct, the customer needs to check with the merchant that they can make purchases of that amount. |
| **312** | Amount outside permitted range | The amount entered is not allowed. Please check and try again. |
| **315** | Operation subject blacklisted | Do not report more detailed information to your customer. Instead, present as you would the generic_decline. |
| **318** | Invalid bank code | Check provided value of the bankCode. |
| **320** | Account limit exceeded | The customer needs to check with the Merchant whether purchase can be made. |
| **325** | Duplicate transaction | Check to see if a recent payment already exists. |
| **330** | Fraudulent | Do not report more detailed information to your customer. Instead, present as you would the generic_decline. |
| **335** | 3D Auth failure | The customer should try again and authenticate payment when prompted during the next transaction. |
| **337** | OTP Auth failure | The card was declined as the transaction requires OTP authentication. |
| **340** | Partial refund is not supported | The partial refund is not supported, only the full refund can be created. |
| **343** | Refunds are not possible for payments older than 6 months. | Refunds are not possible for payments older than 6 months. |
| **344** | Refund is not allowed – Chargeback already made. | Refund is not allowed. A chargeback or pre-dispute has already been initiated for this payment. |
| **345** | Refund amount exceeded | The payment was already fully refunded or the refund a total greater than the original charge amount. |
| **350** | Invalid full name | The customer should try again using the correct full name. |
| **351** | Invalid email | The customer should try again using the correct email. |
| **352** | Invalid customer document | The customer should try again using the correct document type and number. |
| **353** | Invalid account number | The customer should try again using the correct account number. |
| **354** | Invalid account type | The customer should try again using the correct account type. |
| **355** | Invalid phone number | The customer should try again using the correct phone number. |
| **356** | Invalid tax ID | The customer should try again using the correct tax ID. |
| **357** | Invalid country | The correct country should be used in payment. |
| **379** | Not enough data supplied to execute the requested operation. | Not enough data supplied to execute the requested operation. |
| **380** | Balance has Insufficient Funds for credit operations | If customer's balance is insufficient to cover transactions, Commercegate rejects transactions. Customer needs to wait untill balance is top up by incomming deposit payments or to add funds to your account to avoid subsequent transactions being denied with insufficient funds. |
| **401** | Cancelled by customer | The customer cancelled the transaction before completing it. |
| **402** | Cancelled by payment system. Timeout | Ask the customer to attempt the payment again. If subsequent payments are declined, the customer should try another payment method. |
| **403** | Payment method inactive | Cutomer’s account does not have payment method activated. |
| **414** | Payload validation failed | The customer should try again using the correct payload. |
| **415** | Invalid expiry date | The customer should try again using the correct expiration date. |
| **420** | Invalid number | The customer should try again using the correct card number. |
| **429** | Invalid OTP | The customer should try again using the correct OTP. |
| **430** | Invalid cvv | The customer should try again using the correct CVC. |
| **431** | Incorrect date of birth | The customer should try again using the correct date of birth. |
| **432** | incorrect email | The customer should try again using the correct email address. |
| **433** | incorrect number | The customer should try again using the correct card number. |
| **434** | incorrect phone number | The customer should try again using the correct phone number. |
| **435** | incorrect tax id | The customer should try again using the correct Tax Id. |
| **436** | incorrect zip | The customer should try again using the correct billing ZIP/postal code. |
| **437** | incorrect customer data | The customer should try again using the correct date of birth and/or tax id |
| **438** | User Auth failure | The customer should try again and authenticate payment when prompted during the next transaction. |
| **439** | Bank not available | Ask the customer to attempt the payment again. If subsequent payments are declined, the customer should try another payment method. |
| **440** | Bank account not active | Account number is no longer active or blocked, the customer should use another account for payout. |
| **441** | PIX key not found | PIX key is not found, the customer should use another PIX key for payout. |
| **442** | Invalid PIX key | Invalid PIX key, the customer should use another PIX key for payout. |
| **443** | We're experiencing a temporary issue executing this operation. Please try again soon. | The customer should try again later for payout. |
| **450** | Limit exceeded | The customer should contact their card issuer for more information. |
| **455** | Pickup card | The customer needs to contact their card issuer for more information. |
| **456** | Lost card | The specific reason for the decline should not be reported to the customer. Instead, it needs to be presented as a generic decline. |
| **457** | Stolen card | The specific reason for the decline should not be reported to the customer. Instead, it needs to be presented as a generic decline. |
| **458** | Fraudulent by upstream | Do not report more detailed information to your customer. Instead, present as you would the generic_decline. |
| **460** | Do not try again | The customer should contact their card issuer for more information. |
| **465** | Expired card | The customer should use another bank or card data. |
| **467** | Try again later | Ask the customer to attempt the payment again. If subsequent payments are declined, the customer should contact their card issuer for more information. |
| **475** | Transaction not permitted to cardholder | The customer needs to contact their card issuer for more information. |
| **480** | Insufficient funds | The customer should use an alternative payment method or add funds before making the next purchase attemt with this card. |
| **482** | Payment type not supported | The customer needs to contact their card issuer to make sure their card can be used to make this type of purchase. |
| **485** | Restricted card | The customer needs to contact their card issuer for more information. |
| **490** | Service not allowed | The customer should contact their card issuer for more information. |
| **492** | Action not allowed | The customer should contact the merchant or try using an alternative payment method. |
| **496** | Issuer bank declined | The payment should be attempted again. If it still cannot be processed, the customer needs to contact their card issuer. |
| **498** | Generic issuer decline | The customer needs to contact their card issuer for more information. |
| **499** | General decline | The customer needs to contact their card issuer for more information. |
| **510** | Currency is not allowed | The customer needs to check with the Merchant whether purchase can be made in the currency specified. |
| **515** | Account configuration error | The customer needs to check with the Merchant whether purchase can be made with the transaction parameters specified. |
| **520** | Issuer not available | The payment should be attempted again. If it still cannot be processed, the customer needs to contact their card issuer. |
| **525** | NOK Test | Test payment failed |
| **529** | Auto-cancel. timeout | Ask the customer to attempt the payment again. If subsequent payments are declined, the customer should try another payment method. |
| **530** | Card brand currency pair not allowed | The customer needs to check with the Merchant whether purchase can be made in the currency specified. |
| **595** | Technical error | The payment should be attempted again. If it still cannot be processed, try again later. |


## Public IP addresses

To ensure the security of your callback server, we strongly recommend restricting access to it, allowing connections only from CommerceGate Gateway IP addresses.
The following IP addresses are used for external communications (callbacks) with merchants servers and are the same for both Production and Test environments:

```
34.249.210.86
54.217.235.200
13.53.98.197
16.170.72.81
49.12.246.149
5.75.230.69
168.119.38.165
23.88.37.169
185.51.160.13
52.50.20.68
```
Please ensure that your server is configured to accept requests only from these IP addresses to maintain a secure integration with CommerceGate.

documentNumber.description:
The `documentNumber` field represents the individual or legal entity’s unique taxpayer identification number in Brazil. This is a number that is registered in the Government Public Individuals Registry, such as CPF (Cadastro de Pessoas Físicas) or CNPJ (Cadastro Nacional da Pessoa Jurídica) for legal entities.

By sending this field you trigger validateDocumentNumber scenario. In this case only customer with bank-account that registered with the provided "documentNumber" can pay generated QR code. In case with using another bank account, customer will get an error. Please be aware that this error reflects for the customer in their bank application and not reported to us.

**IMPORTANT!** Sending this field triggers also a rule that compares the provided "documentNumber" value with the "documentNumber" value obtained from the BACEN (Brazilian Central Bank) during the validation of the `CustomerInfo.pixOperationDictKey`.

If the `CustomerBankInfo.documentNumber` does not match the documentNumber value associated with the 
`CustomerInfo.pixOperationDictKey` obtained during the validation process, the payout order will be declined. The response will include the following error message: `errMessage: "Fraudulent"`.

userName.description:
identifier of a customer who makes a payment. Usually it can be any ID or login or email which is used at the merchant’s service.

**Important**: this parameter should be associated with single user/account of your service only. This is sensitive parameter and  if you will send the same value for all orders it triggers internal fraud/risk rules and payments could be blocked as result.

identifier of a customer who makes a payout. Usually it can be any ID or login or email which is used at the merchant’s service.

pixOperationDictKey.description:
This parameter is used for payout by pix method only. 
The DICT (Diretório de Identificadores de Contas Transacionais) is a centralized PIX service managed by Bacen that allows you to search for transactional accounts with convenient addressing keys. 
The types of keys currently available are CPF, CNPJ, phone number, e-mail and EVP (random UUID).

**IMPORTANT!** Field is required for country **BR** and  `ConfigurationOptions.paymentMethod` **PIX**. 

| Type       | Exp. regular                                                    | Example                              | Description                                                   |
| ---------- | --------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------ | ------------------------------------------------------------- |
| EVP        | [0-9a-f]{8}-[0-9a-f]{4}-[0-9a-f]{4}-[0-9a-f]{4}-[0-9a-f ]{12}   | 123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426655440000 | Virtual Payment Address is a type of key is generated by DICT |
| CPF        | ^[0-9]{11}$                                                     | 12345678901                          | The CPF number (Portuguese: Cadastro de Pessoas Físicas) is the Brazilian individual taxpayer registry identification |
| CNPJ       | ^[0-9]{14}$                                                     | 12345678901234                       | The Brazilian National Registry of Legal Entities (Portuguese: Cadastro Nacional de Pessoas Jurídicas) |
| EMAIL      | ^[a-z0-9.!#$&'*+\/=?^_`{                                        | pix@bcb.gov.br                       | The email which is used as key for pix account                |
| PHONE      | ^\+[1-9][0-9]\d{1,14}$                                          | +5510998765432                       | The phone number which is used as key for pix account         |

CardType.description: This parameter indicates the type of card being used for a transaction. It distinguishes between debit cards and credit cards. Debit cards draw funds directly from a customer's bank account, while credit cards allow customers to borrow funds from their card issuer, up to a predetermined limit, to make purchases. The CardType is crucial for determining the appropriate processing flow and fees for each transaction, as debit and credit transactions may be subject to different rules, security measures, and costs.

PaymentInstructionsResponse.description: A list of payment instructions detailing the specific parameters for processing a payment for payment method chosen. Accesible while order is not in failed or success status. It provides data to build a checkout UI for the merchant and display payment information to the payers on the merchant's service. Please note that in parallel we send acsServerUrl which contains the an URL for the payer to directly access a ready-to-use checkout form with all payment data formatted and ordered according to the corresponding PaymentInstructions. You can use any of these ways: make redirect of the customer to `acsServerUrl` or build the check out form by using `PaymentInstructions` received.

authorizationCode.description: A credit card authorization code comes in the form of five or six numbers. The code gets generated by the issuing bank, and it’s used to validate credit cards and approve the purchase when a transaction is initiated. Authorization codes are unique to each transaction.

transactionHash.description: A transaction hash is a string of letters and numbers that is generated when a cryptocurrency transaction is initiated. It is a unique identifier that is used to track the transaction on the blockchain. Every transaction that occurs on the blockchain is recorded as a block, and each block has a unique hash.

post.description:
Login and password you can get by the request to your account manager or support request in the [back-office](https://merchants.cgpaytech.com/admin/support/tickets).
It is important to keep your login and password safe as it allows you to perform many privileged operations on your behalf.
Do not share your credentials in a publicly accessible area such as GitHub, client-side code, etc.
Be aware that your back-office credentials can't be used for API access, it`s a different set of credentials.

Authentication to the API is performed via request body in JSON format. As a response to the authentication request, you will get a token that should be used for the subsequent requests.
Token has a lifetime value specified in token response as expiresIn parameter - "expiresIn": 86400 seconds (24 hours).

You can generate multiple active authentication tokens concurrently, ensuring uninterrupted API access.

**Request Time Limit:**
- For optimal performance, it is recommended to set a request time limit of 5000 milliseconds (5 seconds).

put.description:
To create a payment you need to perform a request with payload in JSON format. Requests are identified by a unique, orderId. This endpoint is used for performing payment of any kind:
- Regular card transactions – credit or debit cards
- 3D Secure card transactions, supporting 3D Secure 2.0
- Alternative payment methods ( bizum, boleto, crypto, pix, bank-transfer, voucher, webpay, nequi, codi, upi, passthrough-wallet-card, wallet )

Tokenization is the process of replacing sensitive cardholder data with a surrogate value ("token").

Tokenization greatly reduces the sensitive data that businesses need to store, thus improving security of credit card transactions and minimizing the costs related to PCI DSS compliance.
You can tokenize sensitive card data and use token for following payments.

 **Request Time Limit:**

In this case payment form is hosted at the CommerceGate's side.

This endpoint is used for configuring payment forms to perform payments of any kind:

* Regular card transactions – credit or debit cards
* 3D Secure card transactions, supporting 3D Secure 2.0
* Alternative payment methods ( bizum, boleto, crypto, pix, bank-transfer, voucher, webpay, nequi, codi, upi, passthrough-wallet-card, wallet )
* Card payments subscriptions
* Installment payments – credit card payments with installment plans (include InstallmentConfig in request body)

Please note the payment form session lifetime is limited by 3 minutes by default. It can be increased/reduced by the request.

post.description:
This endpoint is aimed for creating of custom design for payment form. 
To create a custom style of the payment form you need to provide CSS document created according to [CSS tutorial](https://www.w3schools.com/css/) in the request.
As result you will get customCssId the parameter which identifies your custom design in the CommerceGate system. 
This parameter you need to use in the call of the payment form with ConfigurationOptions.customCssId according to [Payments/by hosted payment form (APM's inc.)](#operation/configurePaymentForm) to get wished design of the payment form.

*Important:* the payment form contains many sensitive/mandatory elements according regulations of payment institutions so before the custom style is applied it should be approved by CommerceGate team, before approval the default payment form design is used.

- For optimal performance, it is recommended to set a request time limit of 5000 milliseconds (5 seconds).

post.description:
The endpoint is used to check actual default callback URLs. |
Please note: |
 * default callback URLs will be used for all orders where corresponded URLs were not informed in the initial request payload.
 * you can use default callback URLs as alternative for sending callback URLs for each request.
 * if you send callback URLs in the request and after that make update of default callback URLs the callback will still comming to the URLs provided in the initial request.

 **Request Time Limit:**
- For optimal performance, it is recommended to set a request time limit of 5000 milliseconds (5 seconds).

put.description:
The endpoint is used to add/renew default callback URLs for corresponded operations and states. |
* If some callbackUrl (e.g. onSuccessUrl) in request is not present at all - it will not be changed |
* If some callbackUrl in request is empty (`null` or `""`)  - it will be cleared |
* If some callbackUrl in request is a valid URL - it will be applied |

**Please note**: |
* default callback URLs will be used for all orders where corresponded URLs were not informed in the initial request payload.
* you can use default callback URLs as alternative for sending callback URLs for each request.
* if you send callback URLs in the request and after that make update of default callback URLs the callback will still comming to the URLs provided in the initial request.

 **Request Time Limit:**
- For optimal performance, it is recommended to set a request time limit of 5000 milliseconds (5 seconds).

post.description:
This endpoint provides an ability to cancel active subscription.

In case of an order type subscription there might be two events sent in case when OrderId has terminated status at the moment when the request is performed.
- Cancelled status , that means that subscription is cancelled but paid period is not over yet and merchant needs to still provide premium service for the customer till the end of his membership.
- Terminated status means that paid period for last recurring payment is over and no more recurring attemts will come. Merchant can stop premium service for the customer.

 **Request Time Limit:**
- For optimal performance, it is recommended to set a request time limit of 5000 milliseconds (5 seconds).

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: The orderId value of the payment which created/initiated subscription. It's an orderId with type subscription and it's the fist payment in the the subscription chain. Please note if you will use orderIds which are second , third etc subscription will not be cancelled and you will get an error.

put.description:
If you want to return the funds to your customer, for example if they returned an item, you need to refund the payment.

To process a refund you have to create a new refund order. You can retrieve individual refund for a specific payment as well as a list of all refunds for a specific payment.\
Refunds are identified by an orderId.\
Refund operation is always has a reference to the payment order.\
Partial refunds are allowed conditionally, it depends on what PSP is used for payments/refunds proccessing.\
If refund is done for the any payments from a subscription it will cancel the subscription automatically.

 **Request Time Limit:**
- For optimal performance, it is recommended to set a request time limit of 5000 milliseconds (5 seconds).

post.description:
By using this endpoint you can request to resend a callback for actual orderId state only. Additionally in case of an order type subscription there might be two events sent in case when OrderId has terminated status at the moment when the request is performed.

- Cancelled status means that subscription is cancelled but paid period is not over yet and merchant needs to still provide premium service for the customer till the end of his membership.
- Terminated status means that paid period for last recurring payment is over and no more recurring attemts will come. Merchant can stop premium service for the customer.

In general case as result of api-call merchant will receive one single callback about orderId actual state, but in case if subscription there might be two callbacks come depending on the actual subscription status at the moment of the request is done.

 **Request Time Limit:**
- For optimal performance, it is recommended to set a request time limit of 5000 milliseconds (5 seconds).

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: ID of the Order to resend callbacks
